results.title: Tigerland [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Arnon Milchan, Beau Flynn, Steven Haft, Haft Entertainment, Kirch Media, New Regency Pictures and Regency Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tigerland is the name of a military base in the United States used for the training of recruits before they are to be sent to fight in the war in Vietnam. The film follows the recruits as they are increasingly pushed to the edge of their physical and mental capabilities by a dehumanising military regime convinced that only by brutalising the men will they be able to sufficiently face the terrors of the war ahead. Starring Colin Farrell as Roland Bozz, a young man whose independent spirit and questioning mind puts him immediately at odds with authority, “Tigerland” is a punishing but compelling view of army life. The actual war is in the background. It is as a study of masculinity, repressed sexuality and violence that the film is most effective. Usually known for bloated big-budget action films, director Schumacher has instead, in “Tigerland”, utilised hand-held camerawork, minimal special effects and a concentration on the performances of the actors to achieve his effects. As a late addition to the genre of Vietnam war film, “Tigerland” lacks the immediacy and hallucinatory contradictions of films such as “Apocalypse Now” or “The Deerhunter”: in many ways, for all its kinetic editing and camerawork, it is a traditional genre film. Nevertheless, the performances and the energetic direction ensures that it is both exciting and confronting.

results.title: Singin' in the rain [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gene Kelly, Stanley Donen, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The seemingly eternal freshness of “Singin’ in the rain” may be the result of an unusual degree of improvisation involved in its making. More than most musicals this was a team effort - a coming together of talents striving to overcome the limitations that they saw in the material and given space in which to move. In the process they not only produced one of the finest of movie musicals but also one of the best Hollywood-on-Hollywood movies - an intelligent and affectionate satire on the coming of synchronised sound. It is also a high point of what Richard Dyer calls the Utopian musical of the fifties which erased the distinction between the narrative and the musical numbers, the ultimate management of the contradiction between realism and fantasy inherent in the genre. Features catchy tunes, lively choreography with the athletic grace and Irish charm of Gene Kelly, engaging performances and hilarious jokes. Gene Kelly was co-director, choreographer and actor in this spectacular musical and in 1989 it was one of the first twenty-five films selected by the US Library of Congress for its National Film Registry of significant films.

results.title: The Glenrowan affair
results.creator_credit: Rupert Kathner and Australian Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: This film, based on the Ned Kelly legend, was filmed in and around Benalla by a specialist in low budget quickies with a local football hero, Bob Chitty as Ned. Told from the perspective of an ageing Dan Kelly in present day Benalla, the narrative is presented as a factual retelling of the exploits of the Kelly gang despite its obvious embellishment of the Kelly myth. The shortcomings of the script and its clumsy realisation were derided by the Benalla audience at its premiere and noted by press reviewers upon its brief Sydney release. Narrated by Charles Tingwell. Cast includes: Bob Chitty, Albie Henderson, Ben Crowe, Bill Wright, John Fernside, Chas. Tasman, Charles Webb, Edward Smith, Frank Ransom, Stan Tolhurst. Photography, Harry Malcolm ; editor, Alex Ezard ; sound, Berry Hallett.

results.title: The Princess bride [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scheinman, Rob Reiner and ACT III Communications
results.brief_description: A young boy (Fred Savage), bedridden with the flu, is less than thrilled when his grandfather (Peter Falk) arrives to read aloud the book “The Princess bride”. The story, set in the fairyland kingdom of Florin, recounts the adventures of Buttercup (Robin Wright), the most beautiful woman in the world, and Westley (Cary Elwes), the man she loves. The grandfather promises fencing, chases, escapes, love and miracles. His grandson soon discovers that his adventure story delivers much more. Appearances by Billy Crystal, Carol Kane, Mel Smith and more. Music by Mark Knopfler. Based upon the story by William Goldman.

results.title: Catch 22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, John Calley, Martin Ransohoff, Filmways and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Mike Nichols directed this cinematic adaptation by Buck Henry of Joseph Heller’s scathing, iconic novel, “Catch 22.” Fresh from the success of the anti-establishment hit “The Graduate,” the pair attempted to present an anti-war treatise, epitomised in Heller’s prose. A tale of a small group of flyers in the Mediterranean in 1944, the story centres on Captain Yossarian, a pilot who is manic in his desire to fly no more missions and haunted by the death of a gunner. Yossarian’s plea that he is mad falls on deaf ears - if a pilot knows that flying is a death mission, he is clearly not mad. There are winners, losers, opportunists, and survivors; separately and together they are nervous, frightened, often profane and sometimes pathetic and almost all are a little crazy. Despite slavish adherence to the novel’s plot, Nichols never quite manages to capture the book’s anarchic flavour and thorny, intelligent wit. Nevertheless the film still serves as a timely reminder of the lunacy of combat and Heller’s titular clause retains a stinging indictment on the sanctioned idiocy of war. An all star cast includes Alan Arkin, Art Garfunkel, Anthony Perkins, Martin Sheen, Jon Voight, Orson Welles and Bob Newhart.

results.title: The Iron giant
results.creator_credit: Brad Bird, Allison Abbate, Des McAnuff and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A loving homage to fifties science fiction movies, Brad Bird’s animated “The Iron giant” has a strong sense of that era’s unerring innocence mixed with the looming paranoia of the unfamiliar ‘other’. Based on the 1968 children’s story “Iron man” by British poet laureate Ted Hughes, the film’s archetypal story of fear and prejudice depicts the unusual friendship between a nine year old boy called Hogarth Hughes (voiced by Eli Marienthal) and a giant robot that mysteriously lands in small town Maine circa 1958. The town’s suspicious adults greet the enigmatic visitor with open hostility, pushing the young boy into a protective role with the misunderstood giant. When nosy government agents descend upon the town in search of the robot, Hogarth begins to find hiding the car-eating giant a challenging task. Brad Bird laces this wonderful children’s fantasy with a strong political parable about the cold war fear that permeated every aspect of American society and includes a hilarious cartoon version of the now infamous educational film “Duck and cover”. Cast includes: Jennifer Aniston, Harry Connick JR, Vin Diesel, Cloris Leachman, John Mahoney, M. Emmet Walsh, Christopher McDonald.

results.title: Superstar: the life and times of Andy Warhol
results.creator_credit: Chuck Workman, Aries Cinematografica Argentina and Marilyn Lewis Entertainment
results.brief_description: This documentary on Pop artist Andy Warhol, garnered accolades due to its audacious layering of media messages with archival footage from the art scene of the 70s and 80s. Rather than attempting a literal explanation of the enduring appeal of Warhol’s art, and the public’s fascination with the fabulous nobodies who populated his New York studio, the filmmaker presents a meditation on fame and celebrity, exploring the zeitgeist of the times. Features many intriguing archival interviews with Warhol, which exacerbates his image as a vacuous artist, whilst failing to expose the man behind the myth. Also investigates Warhol’s films that confounded cinemagoers of the day. The unpretentiousness of Warhol’s Pennsylvanian family, who are interviewed at length, contrasts with his high-profile celebrity laden life in New York. Interviews with Warhol’s contemporaries (some archival) include Lou Reed, Joan Quinn, Ultra Violet, Viva, Tom Wolfe, Roy Liechtenstein, Henry Geldzahler, Dennis Hopper, Gerard Malanga, Taylor Mead, John Coplans, David Hockney, Allen Ginsberg, Holly Woodlawn, Bobby Short, Shelley Winters, Sylvia Miles, Paul Morrissey, Fran Lebowitz and Sally Kirkland. Features the music of Blondie, Velvet Underground and Kate Bush.

results.title: Harriet the spy
results.creator_credit: Bronwen Hughes, Mary Kay Powell and Rastar Films
results.brief_description: 11 year old sixth grader Harriet M. Welsch (Michelle Trachtenberg) has an alter ego, she is a spy and aspiring writer who records all the goings on during her designated spy routes as well as her observations about her classmates: best friends Sport (Gregory Smith) and Janie (Vanessa Lee Chester), linked by a concealed tattoo and mutual dislike of class brat Marion Hawthorn. Isolated from her argumentative and absent parents, creative and observant Harriet finds solace in her writing and love with her nanny Ole Golly (Rosie O’Donnell). Harriet’s world is turned upside down when Golly leaves her family’s employment and her notebook is found and read, her private feelings about her friends exposed. Banned from writing, Harriet embarks on a revenge campaign against those who have bullied her since finding out what she really thinks of them, but revenge does not assuage her pain and she has to consider another way to gain forgiveness. At times an agonising coming of age film, the film does have a happy ending with a place for individuality and friendships are restored. Includes a cameo by Eartha Kitt as one of Harriet’s snooping accomplishments. Based on the successful novel by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: 24 = Twenty-four Season one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Spicer, Davis Guggenheim, Frederick King Keller, Ian Toynton, James Whitmore Jr, Jon Cassar, Paul Shapiro, Rodney Charters, Stephen Hopkins, Winrich Kolbe, Andrea Newman, Cyrus Yavneh, Kiefer Sutherland, Michael Loceff, Norman S Powell, Imagine Entertainment (US), Imagine Television, Real Time Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Television
results.brief_description: When “24” was launched on US television it became an immediate cult success. Using real-time it explores the activities of a Counter Terrorist Unit in Los Angeles as they work against the clock combating sophisticated crimes. Features split screens, multiple narrative threads and the latest technology, displaying the tension and complexity of dealing with crimes that span the globe. In series one, set on the day of the California Presidential Primary elections, Jack Bauer and his staff discover an attempt will be made on politician David Palmer’s life. Whilst battling to foil the assassination, Jack suspects that a double-crosser is working within the CTU. Meanwhile Jack’s daughter has snuck out of the house, and is missing, but unbeknownst to her she is a part of the intricate assassination plot. In other narrative threads, Teri Bauer, Jack’s estranged wife, tries to track down her daughter but is also in grave danger. Throughout the unravelling of the twenty-four hours, this drama is incredibly suspenseful, as the protagonists are put through major trauma, whilst dealing with death, murder, violence, blackmail, traitors and the complexity of terrorism and crime. Technology is a major part of the texture of the narrative here: mobile phones, electronic tracking devices, cameras, computers, satellites, the constant hacking and breaking of codes, all add to a sense that electronic machinery can be a menacing force, both friend and foe. But to the writers’ credit, the show also has a great deal of humanity - it ably captures the sense of foreboding, particularly for Jack, whose personal and professional life is compromised under extreme circumstances. Cast includes Kiefer Sutherland, Leslie Hope, Sarah Clarke, Elisha Cuthbert, Xander Berkeley, Dennis Haysbert and Penny Johnson.

results.title: King Lear (Ian Holm)
results.creator_credit: Richard Eyre, Sue Birtwistle, British Broadcasting Corporation and Chestermead
results.brief_description: Ian Holm plays the tragic figure of King Lear who is driven mad by deception and his own foolish egoism. Lear makes a catastrophic decision, ousting the loyal and honest Cordelia, retaining his two remaining deceitful daughters who intend to dethrone him. “King Lear” is a tragedy that repeatedly portrays the restless intolerance of the young towards the old, the powerlessness of virtue in the face of deceit, and the fragility of the bonds which hold families and communities together. In this adaptation, made for television, director Richard Eyre sets the scene with admirable minimalism, allowing for language and gesture to be at the fore of the production, staged by the Royal National Theatre, to great acclaim. A majestic tragedy of misplaced trust and filial ingratitude.
